page.title: 18Agriculture in Holwell
page.content: This area provides good land for dairy farms,all of medium size,100_200 acres some with up to 50 acres arable. Cattle are mainly Friesians;there are also 3 Channel Island herds.Friesians prouduce more milk than Channel Islands but quality is lower.The Milk Marketing board pays according to quality.Prices vary at different times of the year. Farmers milk twice a day in milking parlours,where milk travels along pipelines from cows to bulk tanks. It is stored at low temperatures until taken by tanker daily for processing at the dairy.In summer the cattle are strip fed on grass.Silage and hay are made for winter feed.Silage is grass which is mown,wilted for a day,chopped finely by forage harvester and stored in a clamp in the farmyard.Grass is also dried and baled as hay.
